div.div: κοῦρος : youth, boy, esp. of noble rank, so when applied to the attendants at sacrifices and banquets, as these were regularly the sons of princely houses, Il. 1.470, Od. 1.148; also implying vigorous youth, ability to bear arms, Il. 17.726; son, Od. 19.523.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
